Let's not mess with this door now.
Wanna go to the next puzzle?
Wanna go to the next puzzle?
Let's grab the reward, shall we?
Ooh! What’s this? A human-sized chess room?
\{Anyways, do you know how to play chess?
I’ll be the one to judge that.
We should play sometimes, once we’re out of this mess.
Alright, time for your favourite time!
Usually white starts first, the kind of
convection nobody questions. I wanna make
it easier for a complete noob like you.
Let's start with the most basics of chess pieces:
Whether it's to doom or to victory, it's up to you.
Rookies loves this piece. It's powerful yet easy
enough to control. Pun is very much intended, BTW.
<WordWrap>Rook moves like a plus shape. Up, down, left or right. You decide where to put the piece based on that grid.
<WordWrap>It moves diagonally. Diagonal movement is hard to grasp but once you do, you'll use this piece with ease.
<WordWrap>Next is the knight. The most difficult piece to master, yet one of the most powerful.
<WordWrap>The knight moves like an L shape. The knight's movement can be visualised as a wagon wheel. For me, the overall shape looks like a gear.
The entire point of Chess is to protect your king.
The king is so weak he needs others to protect him.
The king moves one step in his surrounding areas.
Strength isn't always physical, controlling others
to do the dirty job for you is just as powerful.
Just like how you control me!
Last but not least is the queen!
Definitely the most powerful piece in the game!
As they say, behind every powerful king, stands
<WordWrap>The queen has the largest movement range in the game. She mixes both the rook and the bishop movement. Don't lose her too early, she's a keeper!
It's not enough to win Chess competitions,
but it should be enough for those puzzles.
There’s a writing on the wall.
<Center>Three chess puzzles await—solve them to win a necklace's fragment.
After each victory, go through the door on the right.\.
Should be fun and easy enough! Wanna do it?

If you're having difficult time, you can press H
to ask Elly for a hint!
Are you the kind of person who keeps
the most fun task for last?
Well, I suppose I have something to look forward to.

if you didn’t move your king or one of the rooks
